documents.document: @bigmonsterlove haha, it's uncanny though. He'd be wooing Audrey, I think, but he'd be a bad 'un.
This reminds me, whatever happened to Liz's love interest from our Amy's violin class or was that plot line left to die?
It didn't know what Sebastian Barry looks like. Turns out he looks like a Coronation Street lothario.
@voodoo_criminol Subtweeting Nurit is so shady
@AnBurcach That wouldn't surprise me, but I was thinking about her recently and wondered if she was still at it.
@AnBurcach Does the Versailles of Mots woman still write for him?
@leedalyire @Mr_Considerate Yup, they had a panel when they could have just printed a large NO that you could colour in

@electionlit oh no. That's awful, bloody hell.
@electionlit Oh dear. That's not good.
@electionlit hehe. I steered well clear of all of them but I'd a pal stalked by the SWP for a while, like Trotskyist Jehovah's Witnesses.
@electionlit I don't think I was ever given 'the talk' properly but I was warned under no circumstances to put my name/details on a petition
@electionlit 'The talk' just made me properly laugh for the first time today. Good luck with that! :D
@Craicthewhip_ Some welcome good news during this difficult time.
Oh hey, good news. The folks who make the Â£118 leggings are opening a concession in Brown Thomas soon.â€¦ https://t.co/8nlkDXiB3J

It's 2017 and Newsnight is shite entirely. https://t.co/E63xeOH0zy
@EXECUTIVESTEVE I was Fidelma or Dick in the last one but I think that's mostly down to my drink preferences.
@EXECUTIVESTEVE Dick Moran's da, Paddy, used to be the organiser of the Labour Party. That's my random fact of the day.
@EXECUTIVESTEVE Most definitely. Is there a quiz for that? I hope so though I'm going to guess I'm George, because I'm a Prod.
@EXECUTIVESTEVE I know, right? And she'll say nothing, and he'll say nothing, it's ridiculous carry on.
@oconnellhugh Well, that'll learn them.
@johnorthside @KCsixtyseven Well, Paddington Bear in reverse. I was going to say he was from Deepest Darkest Weatherfield but he wasn't...
@KCsixtyseven Ah Spider. Hanging around Peru with Aunt Em
It's twenty years since the cops got Swampy out of his tunnel, though it feels like it should be longer https://t.co/Kjlp4vckC1
Kaine: Not A Coincidence Trump Issued "Holocaust Denial" Statement On Same Day Of Muslim Executive Order https://t.co/bVeQuOuoTk
@delexical This works for me. The floor is sticky and they smell of cabbage.
@delexical I expect they got someone to put it on speed dial for them when they got the phone in. Jesus though.
The level of masochism necessary to listen to Liveline this afternoon is off the charts.
New editor of Today has been announced and it's not Ian Katz, praise the lord. Also, someone please launch Ian Katz into space forever.
@PeterKGeoghegan I came across some Trotskyist article from 1971 or 2 claiming that (it was aimed at the working class, obviously).
So many more important things in life to be annoyed by than a back-to-front fada and a missing fada in this email,â€¦ https://t.co/sFRrF1E0dw
@Hoylesey59 it doesn't suggest it explicitly but it's in the standard death announcement format at a time where cool people keep dying!
@curtainqueen Look at you with all your perfectly in-line blinds. You're living up to your name beautifully!
The trend for writing a tweet as though the subject has just died needs to be knocked on the head pronto. Especiallâ€¦ https://t.co/2YxwRY68wo
@chip_daley It's just devastating. And the horrors that humans are able to tolerate if the scale is big enough.
This is beautiful, from Popbitch <3 https://t.co/95da3VT8BE
@urchinette Ah! I must check that out, I hadn't seen it but found the Happiness Project really good.
@urchinette I was doing ok for a while but I need to re-commit to this (along with a sundry other abandoned good habits!)
@urchinette Yes! I couldn't believe it could be so simple as no social media and read good fun books but it worked from the first night.
@urchinette I haven't but I plan to, it sounds really good.
@urchinette I didn't sleep properly for ages after the election and had to institute a regime that involves no real world after 10pm.
@urchinette It's a tricky thing rn to not engage in the horror beyond the point of endurance. Am keeping my reading deliberately light.
#ff @Stl_Manifes on Holocaust remembrance day.
Take a look at this here https://t.co/tWbIGN3GL3
Top parka-wearer; Hairest historian; Best glasses (before TK Whitaker robbed them); best fringe and most prolific sweary person.
Anyway, I'm pleased to announce I have been nominated for FIVE categories in the Gossies and I hope that I can count on all of yizzer votes
It's a non-runner. You know this, we know this, everyone knows this. Take the day off or something.
There are folks who look down on gossiping about the Kardashians who think whether FG and SF will go into government together is useful chat
@sbprme The biggest!
@msleedy @oceanclub haha, sorry! I should;t but you know the ones I mean, maybe Harbovolk is better...
Of course, we don't know if Trump has a big heart or not because he never released his medical records.
@msleedy @oceanclub Well, we all want a city. The tourists and the Google People don't seem too bothered, and they're who count.
@msleedy That's it exactly. Everything natural will be taken out, replaced by some pasteurised facsimile of the original
@publinie Absolutely. It's awful, I'm so sad about this.
I can't believe this is inevitable. And as for DCC, you can't gut our city and then tell us to be happy that we've a Plaza at College Green.
Was talking to a friend recently about how Belfast is being gutted by gentrification and what they're doing to tryâ€¦ https://t.co/ao1rQ5BnOa
@kevinpmoriarty @urchinette I think touching Grogans would prove the tipping point.
@damianobroin I know! It's terrible news.
@urchinette @msleedy I'm so sad about this. There's almost nothing left as it is, this was one of the last remaining gems.
This is so sad & latest piece of awful news. They're killing off Dublin bit by bit >> Farewell to the Sackville https://t.co/9aZBdvqmx8
@urchinette @Fergal I used play it in work over and over. I must have driven everyone batshit but I couldn't stop listening to it.
@Fergal no, and I don't know if anyone's come close to it since. Twenty years ago though...
@Fergal And it's so very dark. I can stick Porishead on anytime, no bother, but this floors me.
@Fergal I loved this so much. Listened to it again recently and it's still staggeringly good but it reminds me too much of Back Then...
@pmch99 haha, it's too close to the bone! I think I saw the start of that hot mess earlier. Shame because he's very funny. Lol
@pmch99 I don't want to orphan the child but two and a half hours of 'hello little man, hel-lo little man!' is too much.
@pmch99 Please furnish me with details to distract me from the woman behind me who i will kill.
Any craic here? (Entertaining craic only please)
Up at 6. Day in the archives, did interview, got lost in Andersonstown, got lost in Belfast, now on bus with a woman gooing at a baby.
@urchinette wasn't she just deadly? <3
Aged 98, Betty Tebbs couldnâ€™t wait for her telegram from the Queen, â€œSo I can send it straight back to her.â€ https://t.co/WwIjd7rkVu
@pmch99 it's arrogance in its purest form.
@pmch99 it's too much.
Maybe I missed it. Anyway, this is terrible.

@sbprme @pmch99 As #sunzu teaches us, #thoughtexperiment is the first refuge of the criminally tedious.

@urchinette Well, I don't know if they're all there, but I'm on S1E2 here https://t.co/wJy44S5uLt
@urchinette I would watch that but I'm too busy watching the MTM Show from the beginning. God bless YouTube
@etienneshrdlu @johnorthside It doesn't take much, you just have to mention his name. If I'd had to work harder for it I'd be more proud.
@johnorthside @etienneshrdlu Same. Though probably more highly amused than proud.
This is a bit of a daft question, but is there a version of the BT phonebook that has people's first names in it? Online its initial only.
@andgoseek Is that 15 of the little ones, the way you get two in a bar, if that makes sense?
@KCsixtyseven Was my first thought. The nerve of them
If not being entirely retrograde about gay people is a fundamental American value, their Vice President wants deporting. What a sham.
LRT - that US executive order will impose a values test on Muslims, asking them about their views on homosexuality, inter alia.
@markocular That I can't help you with but this is a good example of it https://t.co/hyPfdwf6As
@markocular Ah, there's a huge connection, esp. between Ulster and Scotland, but the 'language' of Ulster-Scots is a political invention
@markocular Scots is lowland Scots, not Scots Gaelic, but it's not a language, its a dialect.
@markocular Parity of esteem innit.
@sbprme oh ffs, I've misremembered. The only thing in it in Ulster Scots is the title. Orange Fest in Banbridge though, seriously
@obrien_jonathan Amazing It is a sophisticated culture, let there be nae doubt.
@sbprme but as though it had been written by Rabbie Burns. Or maybe Irvine Welsh.
@sbprme It's hilarious. I picked up a copy in the Ulster American Folk Museum once, all stuff about the joys of marching season...
Here's Oot and Aboot, an annual magazine for the Ulster-Scots community. You probably won't understand it though... https://t.co/ufWEh7qfOL
